statements: SELECT tutorial_title, tutorial_description FROM tutorials;
SELECT * FROM tutorials WHERE tutorial_id = 1;
SELECT tutorial_title, created_date FROM tutorials WHERE tutorial_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM tutorials ORDER BY created_date DESC;
SELECT tutorial_title FROM tutorials WHERE tutorial_id IN (2, 4);
SELECT * FROM tutorials WHERE tutorial_id = 1;
SELECT tutorial_title, tutorial_description FROM tutorials WHERE created_date > '2021-01-01';
SELECT * FROM tutorials ORDER BY created_date DESC LIMIT 3;
SELECT tutorial_id, tutorial_title FROM tutorials WHERE tutorial_description LIKE '%SQL%';
SELECT tutorial_id, tutorial_title, created_date FROM tutorials WHERE tutorial_description IS NOT NULL ORDER BY tutorial_title ASC;
SELECT * FROM students;
SELECT name, email FROM students WHERE cohort_id = 1;
SELECT id, name, email FROM students WHERE id = 3;
SELECT * FROM queries WHERE executed = true;
SELECT query_text FROM queries WHERE student_id = 5;
SELECT * FROM students WHERE cohort_id = 1 ORDER BY name ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT name, email FROM students WHERE id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT id, name FROM students WHERE email LIKE '%@example.com';
SELECT * FROM queries ORDER BY executed DESC, id ASC;
SELECT student_id, COUNT(id) AS query_count FROM queries GROUP BY student_id HAVING query_count > 3 ORDER BY query_count DESC;
SELECT * FROM student;
SELECT name, email FROM student ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT tutorial_name, difficulty_level FROM tutorial WHERE difficulty_level='Beginner';
SELECT query_text, execution_time FROM query_history WHERE execution_time > 5;
SELECT student.name, tutorial.tutorial_name FROM student JOIN query_history ON student.id = query_history.student_id JOIN tutorial ON tutorial.tutorial_id = query_history.tutorial_id;
SELECT * FROM student;
SELECT id, name, email FROM student WHERE id = 1;
SELECT tutorial_name, difficulty_level FROM tutorial WHERE difficulty_level = 'Intermediate';
SELECT student.name, tutorial.tutorial_name FROM student JOIN query_history ON student.id = query_history.student_id JOIN tutorial ON tutorial.tutorial_id = query_history.tutorial_id;
SELECT student.name AS 'Student Name', tutorial.tutorial_name AS 'Tutorial Name' FROM student, tutorial WHERE student.id = 1 AND tutorial.tutorial_id = 2;
SELECT * FROM students;
SELECT name, age FROM students WHERE age > 20;
SELECT title, category FROM tutorials ORDER BY title DESC;
SELECT query, rating FROM queries WHERE rating > 4.5;
SELECT * FROM ratings WHERE stars >= 3.0 AND comment IS NOT NULL;
SELECT name, age FROM students WHERE age > 20 ORDER BY name ASC
SELECT * FROM tutorials WHERE category = 'SQL' ORDER BY tutorial_id DESC
SELECT q.query_id, q.query, r.stars, r.comment FROM queries q JOIN ratings r ON q.query_id = r.query_id WHERE r.stars >= 4
SELECT s.name, t.title, r.stars FROM students s JOIN queries q ON s.student_id = q.student_id JOIN tutorials t ON q.tutorial_id = t.tutorial_id WHERE s.age < 25 ORDER BY s.name ASC, r.stars DESC
SELECT t.title, t.author, COUNT(q.query_id) as total_queries FROM tutorials t LEFT JOIN queries q ON t.tutorial_id = q.tutorial_id GROUP BY t.title, t.author ORDER BY total_queries DESC
SELECT * FROM Students;
SELECT tutorial_name, difficulty_level FROM Tutorials ORDER BY difficulty_level DESC;
SELECT student_name, email FROM Students WHERE student_id = 2;
SELECT tutorial_id, tutorial_name FROM Tutorials WHERE difficulty_level > 2;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_students FROM Students;
SELECT student_name, email FROM Students ORDER BY student_name ASC;
SELECT tutorial_name, difficulty_level FROM Tutorials WHERE difficulty_level > 5 ORDER BY difficulty_level DESC;

SELECT student_name, email, tutorial_name FROM Students JOIN TutorialProgress ON Students.student_id = TutorialProgress.student_id JOIN Tutorials ON TutorialProgress.tutorial_id = Tutorials.tutorial_id;

SELECT student_name, tutorial_name, progress_percentage FROM Students JOIN TutorialProgress ON Students.student_id = TutorialProgress.student_id JOIN Tutorials ON TutorialProgress.tutorial_id = Tutorials.tutorial_id WHERE progress_percentage >= 50 ORDER BY progress_percentage DESC;

SELECT student_name, tutorial_name, question_text FROM Students JOIN TutorialProgress ON Students.student_id = TutorialProgress.student_id JOIN Tutorials ON TutorialProgress.tutorial_id = Tutorials.tutorial_id JOIN TutorialQuestions ON Tutorials.tutorial_id = TutorialQuestions.tutorial_id ORDER BY student_name ASC, tutorial_name DESC;
